title: How to Turn a Photo Into a Puzzle

steps.title: Take the photo that you would like to make into a puzzle and blow it up to the size you want to make.
steps.content: Take the photo that you would like to make into a puzzle and blow it up to the size you want to make. A4 or A3 is recommended. You can do this with a normal photocopier or go through a photo processing store for a glossier print.

steps.title: Get a piece of thin cardboard (colored card) the size of your photo.
steps.content: Get a piece of thin cardboard (colored card) the size of your photo. When mounting your photo, consider using a piece of wood as a backer board to provide extra support and stability. Cut the wood to ensure it fits the frame perfectly.

steps.title: Using an acid-free glue, glue the photo to the card.
steps.content: Using an acid-free glue, glue the photo to the card. Make sure you get it corner to corner. A paper cutter can clean edges so they are aligned.

steps.title: Cut out shapes using a Stanley knife or X-Acto knife.
steps.content: Cut out shapes using a Stanley knife or X-Acto knife. It may be helpful for you to use a pencil to trace out shapes on the back of the puzzle before you begin cutting. You could do this freehand, or trace around jigsaw puzzle pieces from a commercial jigsaw puzzle.

steps.title: Jumble the puzzle pieces and hand them to a friend to solve.
steps.content: Jumble the puzzle pieces and hand them to a friend to solve.
